name: Version 1.9.7
body:
## What's Changed
* Improve event handling in async stream by @flacjacket in https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/pull/213


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/compare/1.9.6...1.9.7

name: Version 1.9.6
body:
## What's Changed
* Raise timeout exception from async stream by @flacjacket in https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/pull/211
* Improve event data handling by @flacjacket in https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/pull/212


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/compare/1.9.5...1.9.6

name: Version 1.9.5
body:
## What's Changed
* Fix bug in privacy mode by @pjrt in https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/pull/199
* Change caught httpx error type by @flacjacket in https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/pull/208
* Allow specifying stream to turn audio and video on or off by @flacjacket in https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/pull/210


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/tchellomello/python-amcrest/compare/1.9.4...1.9.5

name: Version 1.9.4
body: * Make httpx follow redirects by default

name: Version 1.9.3
body: * Fix bug with camera not being able to be setup in thread without asyncio loop setup

name: Version 1.9.2
body: Fix bug in async_vendor_information use of pretty parsing

name: Version 1.9.1
body: The vendor_information system property was missed in adding pretty parsing to the system properties for 1.9.0. Add parsing for this property.

name: Version 1.9.0
body:
Breaking changes
* Drop support for Python 3.6.

New features
* Add new async APIs.

Minor fixes
* Change all system properties, such as hardware_version, to be parsed
  out.
* Fix the audio enabled to correctly return the value for the given
  channel.  This is equivelant to the video fix added in 1.8.1.
* Handle errors fetching the record mode more gracefully.
* Fix the move left/right PTZ commands to take speed as "horizontal".
* Change PTZ commands to return bool rather than str with "ok".

name: Version 1.8.1
body:
## New features
* Add privacy mode control

## Bug fixes:
* Fix software_information not returning correct version
* Change is_video_enabled to report only main stream

name: Version 1.8.0
body:
Breaking changes
==

* Python 2 no longer supported, Python 3.6 is the minimum required version
* PTZ commands (e.g. `zoom_in`, `move_left`) require boolean value for `start` parameter, rather than `"start"` and `"stop"` strings for the `action` parameter

New features
==

* Smart motion detection events added as `is_human_detected` and `is_vehicle_detected` properties.
* Added methods to query separate channels to allow using multiple cameras on NVRs.
* New position_abs PTZ function to allow for absolute angular positioning.
* New function to override ONVIF login checking for admin-only.
* Type annotations added to allow for type checking.

name: Version 1.7.2
body: the function event_actions now return (event name, payload)

name: Version 1.7.1
body:
- Removed the hardcoded encoding type for the method play wav (#154)
- socket.TCP_KEEP* are not defined on some systems (#156)

name: Version 1.7.0
body: - Add method to process event stream #153

name: Version 1.6.0
body:
- Add is_alarm_triggered to check for AlarmLocal events #144
- Add IP5M-1176EB as supported device #145
- Add event_stream() which returns stream of camera events #146
- Add IP8M-2496 to support matrix #148

name: Version 1.5.6
body: Allow snapshot without stream & no comm during init (#142)

name: Version 1.5.5
body: Fix error handling for authentication and no longer use session for retries (#141)

name: Version 1.5.4
body: Many thanks to @tchatard @antlarr @dshokouhi @dougsland @KevinBdn @nitrag @pnbruckner for your contributions!!

name: Version 1.5.3
body: ### Remove object addresses from log messages so they don't all look unique.

name: Version 1.5.2
body:
### Fix snapshot channel parameter.

Default snapshot channel to None, in which case, do not send channel parameter in URL.

name: Version 1.5.1
body:
### Fix improper retrying, especially when using Digest Authentication.

No longer do retrying at the urllib3 level via an HTTPAdapter, since it won't properly handle handle errors after the initial Digest Authentication exchange. Rather bring back the retry loop in the command method. Also don't retry if error 401 is returned when trying auth protocols in _generate_token method.

name: Version 1.5.0
body:
### Errors during initialization are no longer fatal.

- Allow AmcrestCamera object (and hence Http object) to be created even if communication errors occur. This allows user to use the object to attempt communicating with camera later to implement an error recovery scheme.

- retries_connection == 0 means don't attempt retries. I.e., only use default value if retries_connection == None.

- Add some debug messages to help user diagnose communication problems.

- For most commands do not use stream for request to centralize error handling. Only use stream for those few commands that need it, and add error handling to those when using raw.data.

- Remove retry loop in command method. It's redundanct and unnecessary.

name: Version 1.4.1
body: - rtsp_url, storage_all, storage_used, storage_used_percent & storage_total caught comm errors. They should be passed up to let app deal with them.

name: Version 1.4.0
body:
- storage_used_percent property now only sends one command to camera.
- Add storage_all property that returns, as a dictionary, the same values as storage_used, storage_total & storage_used_percent properties, but by only sending one command to camera.

name: Version 1.3.0
body:
- Add audio/video enable properties - #113 @pnbruckner
- Add new ptz & video commands
- Handle errors in storage methods

name: Version 1.2.7
body: - Use camera's configured RTSP port - #111 @pnbruckner

name: Version 1.2.6
body: - Use unique amcrest exceptions - #108 @pnbruckner

name: Version 1.2.5
body: * Rollback requests.Session threading - @pnbruckner #106

name: Version 1.2.4
body:
* Fixed typo report on issue - #101 @tchellomello 
* Fix command error handling after last retry - #103  @pnbruckner 
* Reuse command sessions - #104  @pnbruckner

name: Version 1.2.3
body: * Updated PyPi long_description

name: V 1.2.2
body:
Python Amcrest Version 1.2.2

- Added missing python files @dougsland 
- Added presentation from Boston Python Linux Group @dougsland 
- Updated supported models (#88) @kdsudac 
- Updated supported models (#91) @briandconnelly 
- Added fix so that correct exception is caught, thus allowing HttpDigestAuth method to be attempted (#92) @adpriebe 
- Fixed lint (#93) @tchellomello
- Added IP3M-956B to supportability matrix docs (#94) @adpriebe 
- Added setter for recording on motion detection (#95) @adpriebe 

Special thanks to @dougsland @kdsudac @briandconnelly  and @adpriebe which helped on this release. You guys rock!!!

name: v1.2.0
body:
* Using new format with sub-branches amcrest-1.2.x
* Added mpeg_url() and rtsp_url() methods

- Added support to new Amcrest firmware V2.400.AC01.15.R.20170328 david@neongoat.com
- Added support to new Amcrest firmware V2.420.AC00.17.R.20170322 david@neongoat.com

Many thanks to @dparker18 :+1:

- Reverted patch 20f527eb which broke external 3rd party applications
- Added UPNP support
- Exported version via API and command line.
Exposed method get_base_url()

- Implemented tests with Travis
- Added configuration file ~/.config/amcrest.conf
- Added NTP support
- Introduced to customize timeout parameters
- Supported notification when motion is dected
- Minor bug fixes and enhancements

name: Initial python-amcrest version
body: Initial python-amcrest version.
